column1: Peter was most dreadfully frightened; he rushed all over the garden
column2: for he had forgotten the way back to the gate.He lost one of his shoes among the cabbages
column3: and the other shoe amongst the potatoes.After losing them
column4: he ran on four legs and went faster
column5: so that I think he might have got away altogether if he had not unfortunately run into a gooseberry net
column6: and got caught by the large buttons on his jacket. It was a blue jacket with brass buttons
column7: quite new.Peter gave himself up for lost
column8: and shed big tears; but his sobs were overheard by some friendly sparrows
column9: who flew to him in great excitement
column10: and implored him to exert himself.Mr. McGregor came up with a sieve
column11: which he intended to pop upon the top of Peter; but Peter wriggled out just in time
column12: leaving his jacket behind him.And rushed into the tool-shed
column13: and jumped into a can. It would have been a beautiful thing to hide in
column14: if it had not had so much water in it.
